Welcome to django-conduit’s documentation!¶

django-conduit is a RESTful API library for Django. Its primary goals are:

  1. Easy to Use
  2. Easy to Understand
  3. Easy to Extend

Hasty Start¶

Use this to immediately start playing around with your models in API form. Don’t use in production.

  1. In your main URLConf (urls.py), add the following:

    from conduit.api.utils import AutoAPI
api = AutoAPI()

urlpatterns = patterns('',
    ...
    url(r'^api/', include(api.urls)),
    ...
)

  2. Visit http://localhost:8000/api/v1/[yourmodelnamehere]

You’re done! The AutoAPI scans your Django project for all models and exposes them via an api.

Warning

DO NOT USE THIS IN PRODUCTION! It exposes all your project data.

Quick Start¶

  1. Install via PyPI: pip install django-conduit

  2. Create or use an existing model in your [app]/models.py

  3. Add the following resource to your [app]/views.py:

    from conduit.api import ModelResource
from [app].models import [Model]


class [Model]Resource(ModelResource):
    class Meta(ModelResource.Meta):
        model = [Model]

  4. Add the following to your urls.py:

    from conduit.api import Api
from [app].views import [Model]Resource

api = Api()
api.register([Model]Resource())

urlpatterns = patterns('',
    url(r'^api/', include(api.urls)),
    url(r'^admin/', include(admin.site.urls)),
)

  5. Visit localhost:8000/api/v1/[model] to fetch a list of your resource
